PYRIMETHAMINE WITH SULFADOXINE

Indications and doses

Adjunct to quinine in treatment of Plasmodium falciparum malaria,

By mouth

  • For adults
    75/1500 mg for 1 dose.
  • For children 1 month–3 years (body-weight 5 kg and above)
    12.5/250 mg for 1 dose.
  • For children 5 years
    25/500 mg for 1 dose.
  • For children 7–8 years
    37.5/750 mg for 1 dose.
  • For children 10–13 years
    50/1000 mg for 1 dose.
  • For children 14–17 years
    75/1500 mg for 1 dose.

Malaria prophylaxis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Not recommended by UK malaria experts.

Dose equivalence and conversion

Dose quantities are expressed in the form x/y where x and y are the strengths in milligrams of pyrimethamine and sulfadoxine respectively.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Possible teratogenic risk in first trimester (pyrimethamine a folate antagonist); in third trimester— risk of neonatal haemolysis and methaemoglobinaemia.

Fear of increased risk of kernicterus in neonates appears to be unfounded.

Contra indications

  • Acute porphyrias

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Diarrhoea, headache, hyperkalaemia, nausea, rash,

uncommon: Vomiting,

veryRare: Anorexia, antibiotic-associated colitis, arthralgia, aseptic meningitis, ataxia, blood disorders, convulsions, cough, depression, eosinophilia, glossitis, hallucinations, hepatic necrosis, hypoglycaemia, hyponatraemia, interstitial nephritis, jaundice, leucopenia, liver damage, megaloblastic anaemia, myalgia, myocarditis, pancreatitis, peripheral neuropathy, photosensitivity, renal disorders, rhabdomyolysis reported in HIV-infected patients, shortness of breath, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, stomatitis, systemic lupus erythematosus, thrombocytopenia, tinnitus, toxic epidermal necrolysis, uveitis, vasculitis, vertigo,

notKnown: Allergic alveolitis, eosinophilic alveolitis, pulmonary infiltrates,

Discontinue immediately if blood disorders or rash occur.

Discontinue if cough or shortness of breath occur.

Advice for patients and carers

Patients should be advised to maintain adequate fluid intake.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Asthma
  • avoid in blood disorders (unless under specialist supervision)
  • : avoid in infants under 6 weeks in children
  • : elderly in adults
  • G6PD deficiency
  • history of seizures—avoid large loading doses
  • not recommended for prophylaxis (severe side-effects on long-term use)
  • predisposition to folate deficiency
  • : predisposition to hyperkalaemia in adults

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor blood counts on prolonged treatment.

Unlicensed use

In children

Not licensed for use in children of body-weight under 5 kg.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Also known as Fansidar .

Advice regarding allergies and cross sensitivities

Contra-indicated in patients with sulfonamide allergy.
